Résumé

Résumé

About me

My name is Nick Coad and I'm a web developer from Launceston, Tasmania. I've been practicing web development in my spare time for 15 years and professionally for 6 years - first as a contracted freelance web developer and currently as a full-time web developer for VETtrak Pty Ltd. I have a wide range of web-based skills and knowledge all of which are summarised on this page.

Work experience

VETtrak Pty Ltd

Web Developer

September 2013 - Current

Description

During my time at OzSoft as a Database Software Support officer, I was offered a position as a web developer at another company. OzSoft had no web developers at all but made a new position for me so I could stay on as OzSoft's web developer. (The company has since rebranded to VETtrak Pty Ltd).

The web development role covered everything web related at the company as I was the only web developer on staff. This included the re-development of the OzSoft website using Sitefinity, an ASP.NET based CMS. This project included many custom integrations with the Sitefinity software so that customers in our proprietary customer management software could use their existing credentials to log into the CMS and manage their records with us.

The role also included the development of four software products that we subsequently released for sale. Details on two of the larger projects - the VETtrak Trainer Portal and the VETtrak Student Portal can be found in the Portfolio section.

Responsibilities

  • New product development
  • Development/maintenance of company website

OzSoft Solutions Pty Ltd

Database Software Support

January 2007 - September 2013

Description

While working at OzSoft in the Database Software Support role, I handled a wide range of tasks focused around customer service. This included producing 'custom reports' for our clients that we developed using a combination of Firebird SQL, MS SQL Server and PascalScript.

This role involved a lot of interaction with customers on topics that were often quite technical. From this role I have gained experience in talking to non-technical people about technical matters and am able to do so in a friendly, relateable way.

Responsibilities

Portfolio

Portfolio

VETtrak Trainer Portal

The VETtrak Trainer Portal is designed to integrate with VETtrak Pty Ltd's primary software solution VETtrak®. The Trainer Portal allows our customers to sign in and manage their students including the recording of results, attendance and more. The software also boasts a sophisticated Quality Assurance system allowing an administrator to approve all changes that come in through the portal so that our clients can maintain tight control over the quality of their data.

This project included the development of a C# API to communicate with the VETtrak database in a way that respected the business logic already present in the software, so that information entered through the API is stored and managed in the same way as data entered through the main software.

VETtrak Student Portal

The VETtrak Student Portal is designed to integrate with VETtrak Pty Ltd's primary software solution VETtrak®. The Student Portal allows our customers to provide their students with a username and password that they can use to sign and view their course progress and upload or download files against units of competency. This allows a student to submit file-based evidence for trainers to review through the Trainer Portal.

This project also makes use of the C# API developed for the Trainer Portal.

Bad @ Video Games

This was a website designed and built for a friend. The website was based on the WordPress CMS and the design was implemented as a WordPress theme.

Athena Athletica

This project is a design-only project for a friend's business venture that didn't eventuate. I was asked to provide a design that looked modern and communicated a sense of health and well-being. Using stock photography of people undergoing exercise both in the gym and in nature gave the site a fresh and healthy look.
